item.title: Handling push notifications and LQSession.handlePush.
item.dc:creator: oyvind
item.description:
According to the documentation here: http://developers.geoloqi.com/ios/docs/Classes/LQSession.html for LQSession.handlePush method:
If a push notification is received when your app is in the foreground, you can call this method from the app delegate and the SDK will handle everything for you
When the app is running and I delegate to this method is displays an alert view with "View" and "Close" buttons.  How do I do something in response to the user tapping "View" button.

item.title: How to limit the number of push per day
item.dc:creator: Concepto
item.description:
I want to limit the number of available push notifications by geo reference per day

Is there a way to do it?

We have several places and we wanto to stop triggering push notifications when the limit is reached


Tnks in advance

item.title: Titanium module not found
item.dc:creator: awarzon
item.description:
All of the links from http://developers.geoloqi.com/titanium to download the Geoloqi module on the Titanium marketplace are broken. They give 404 page not found errors. When I search the Titanium marketplace for "geoloqi" I get no results.

Where is the Geoloqi Titanium module? Thanks.

item.title: GeoLoqi Server Lag problem Android
item.dc:creator: rajababar
item.description:
Hi Geoloqi team,
I have observed that the triggers doesn't work before its 6 pm (Pakistan Standard Time), i have created the triggers without any criteria of time and date.
Before 6 pm whether i enter or exit the geo fence, triggers doesn't work but after 6 pm the triggers work very good, is this some thing that your servers are being down at that time, please help me this being a big pain since i cannot test any thing before 6

item.title: Class not found exception Geoloqi Android Sdk
item.dc:creator: s3techummi
item.description:
i have downloaded the Geoloqi Android Sdk from Github when i try to run the sdk i get Class not found exception 
07-09 11:21:01.951: E/AndroidRuntime(264): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to instantiate activity ComponentInfo{com.geoloqi.android.sample/com.geoloqi.android.sample.ui.LauncherActivity}: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.geoloqi.android.sample.ui.LauncherActivity in loader dalvik.system.PathClassLoader[/data/app/com.geoloqi.android.sample-1.apk]

Please help me

item.description: i create layer,place and also add trigger including the trigger type,trigger message,time,date but i cant get any push notification.but when i create a Geo note through Geo notes android application and my test application using the api call getting the push notification,why i didn't get the trigger message .

item.title: PHP User List.
item.dc:creator: TQwr1jszr5NZUxMT
item.description:
Using the PHP-SDK I am unable to use the LIMIT on the user/list. It always returns 25 users...

$paging['limit'] = "10";
$response = $GLOBALS['geoloqi']->post('user/list', array(
'limit' => "10",
'client_id' => variable_get('geoloqi_api_key', ''),
'client_secret' => variable_get('geoloqi_api_secret', ''),
), &$headers);
if (isset($response->error_code)) {
form_set_error('key', t('Unable to get userlist' . $response->error_code));
return t('');
}

item.title: iOS Devices not getting Push even after success from API console
item.dc:creator: nestmy
item.description:
The message/send POST call from API console sends the push successfully but the iOS app is not able to receive it,
this was working for us 2 weeks back.

The code used to register push :









[LQSession setAPIKey:@"d0ce2db5956fdadd0f757bd11221fdf6"];


    if([LQSession savedSession]) {


        [LQTracker sharedTracker];


        [LQSession registerForPushNotificationsWithCallback:NULL];


        NSLog(@"Saved GEOLOQI User ID %@",[[LQSession savedSession] userID]);


    } else {


        [LQSession createAnonymousUserAccountWithUserInfo:nil completion:^(LQSession *session, NSError *error) {


            if(error) {


                NSLog(@"ERROR: Failed to create account: %@", error);


            } else {


                [LQSession setSavedSession:session];


                NSLog(@"User ID %@",[session userID]);


                [LQSession registerForPushNotificationsWithCallback:^(NSData *deviceToken, NSError *error) {


                    if(error){


                        NSLog(@"Failed to register for push tokens: %@", error);


                    } else {


                        NSLog(@"Got a push token! %@", deviceToken);


                        NSLog(@"GEOLOQI User ID %@",[session userID]);


                    }


                }];


                // Start tracking


                [[LQTracker sharedTracker] setProfile:LQTrackerProfileAdaptive];


            }


        }];


    }




    // Tell the SDK the app finished launching so it can properly handle push notifications, etc


    [LQSession application:application didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:launchOptions];

item.title: Developers > Layers > settings tab inaccessible
item.dc:creator: monking
item.description:
Clicking the "settings" tab on http://developers.geoloqi.com/account/layers/XXXX/edit has no effect.

steps to reproduce
1) Log in to an account with an application and layer
2) Click "Your Account" in the top right corner
3) Click "Layers" in the "Developers" section
4) Click the "Edit" button on a layer under your application
5) Click the "Settings" tab on the left panel

gps is not getting fixes. might be the case library is not using wake lock concept.

Thanks
Akram

Anyone got a work around?

item.title: Javascript Library not working?
item.dc:creator: ericironsidegmailcom
item.description:
Tried the simple examples for javascript, but it doesn't get past the following line loading the geoloqi library ("t is null'). All other resulting calls result in a "geoloqi is null" error (which makes sense since the library didn't load).

<script type="text/javascript" src="http://api.geoloqi.com/js/geoloqi.min.js"></script>

What am I doing wrong?

item.title: Trigger/Run - Not generating a push message to the phone
item.dc:creator: TQwr1jszr5NZUxMT
item.description:
If I understand correctly. If I do a trigger/run. Then it should also send the push notifcation to the phone/app. But I can see that it is queued but I never get a push notification on the phone.  Using Titanium. I get this back when I run the Trigger/Run from inside the app....but never see a message on the screen. I.E. Push Notification.


Response: {
   message = "Free Small Fry with Purchase of Burger";
   result = queued;
   type = message;

item.title: android sdk: getting group/create api call to work
item.dc:creator: rentaow
item.description: I'm coding a project using the android sdk. I want to use the api method call group/create, but in my OnRunApiRequestListener() inner class, onComplete() keeps returning instead of onSuccess(). The error code that I find in logcat is "HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request". I looked it up on geoloqi's website and the error code said that "Auth token found in GET or POST when token present in header". Not entirely sure what this means, but I think it has something to do with the fact that group/create requires an application access token. I have an application access token, but I don't know where to put it in my project. What do I do?

item.title: Batch place create with "geocode" and "radius" set... incorrect radius
item.dc:creator: SoftelBE
item.description:
Hi,

When using the API creating places in batches with geocode set to an address and radius set to 100. The radius that has actually been set in geoloqi isn't 100. Some of the radiuses are even as large as around 6500m, which gives us a lot of false positives. Was this caused by some changes in your API and how do we fix this?

Also we have one batch left that needs to be created in Geoloqi and geocoded by Esri but the connection of the API call keeps getting closed unexpectedly by the server. I think this happens for 1 user of the application specifically. Any idea why?

Thanks.

(At the moment we are updating all the places (in batch) for all the users of our application to a radius of 100, which seems to be working. But I have no idea what this is doing in your backend. Of course this isn't a solution to the problem.)

item.title: Some Geo fencing messages not getting triggered in Android.
item.dc:creator: awarrier
item.description:
I signed up for a free account with Geo Loqi , downloaded the GEONOTES app on Android.

Also once i signed up for a new account online, i logged int o my account on the web and created a new Test Layer and added geo fences to that layer. TO test this , i started driving through these geo fences with my GEONOTES APP runnign with GPS and Google Location Services Turned ON, it sent me some messages for ENTRY and EXIT messages, just for one .

I did not get any messages for any of the other geo fences, even though i did a refresh on my mobile device, even signed out and signed in...still nothing...

any ideas thoughts on what might be wrong here? Here is the approximate radius i set for all the visually created geo fences

GEO FENCE RADIUS

 322 meters 

360 meters

 237 meters 

100 meters 

195 meters 

193 meters

 189 meters

is this a latency issue ?.. I am sure that i have not crossed the 100 limit for FREE Account , since i just started using it.. Then what could be wrong here.?

item.title: message/send not working
item.dc:creator: HPdRa1juJ2ePMcF8
item.description:
Hi,

When I use message/send on the console with these parameters:

text: test
layer_id: 4Lk2
user_id: 2PJy

I receive the following return:

{
"result": "ok",
"devices": 2,
"user": "udbef124748e595349dc40fba9bbd7f15",
"user_id": "2PJy"
}

but no push is received by the device. However, if I use message/broadcast to the same layer_id, the device receive the notification.

What may be wrong?

Thanks

item.title: Titanium Geoloqi Plugin - Place/Update does not work
item.dc:creator: bp4151
item.description:
All,

I am using Appcelerator Titanium SDK 3.0 and Geoloqi plugin 1.2 for my app. I can see my Geoloqi place/info call, but when I try to make the place/update to change the radius, there is no call made and no error. I see no activity on the phone, no onSuccess or onFailure events triggered, no debug information either on the phone or on the Geoloqi debugger. I tried downgrading to Titanium SDK 2.1.4 with no success.


function UpdatePlace(placeID, radius, latitude, longitude) {
    Ti.API.log('UpdatePlace');
    try {
        geoloqi.session.postRequest("place/update/" + placeID, {
            radius: radius,
            latitude: latitude,
            longitude: longitude
        }, {
            onSucess: function (data) {
                Ti.API.log(JSON.stringify(data));
                alert('Alert update was successful!');
            },
            onFailure: function (data) {
                Ti.API.log(JSON.stringify(data));
                alert('There was a problem updating the area of your alert.')
            }
        });
    } catch (e) {
        alert(e);
    }
}

Can we either get a fix to the plugin or can someone suggest a workaround to changing the radius of a place? 

Thanks,
Bruce
